message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about cacti and their adaptations to survive in arid environments. Cacti have specialized tissues and structures that allow them to store water. They keep a cache of water inside their stems and can hold onto it for long periods of time. Option (A) is incorrect because cacti do not spit out water. Option (B) is incorrect because cacti do not make the water dirty. Option (D) is incorrect because cacti do not filter water.

Option (C) is the correct answer because cacti have specialized tissues that can store water, allowing them to survive in arid conditions.
